The movie stars talented actors like Alicia Witt and Loretta Devine, promising an engaging watch! Enjoy the spooky ride!

Given your interest in language and truth, I'd highly recommend "Zero Effect" starring Ben Stiller and Ryan O'Neal. This film is a mystery about a brilliant but socially awkward detective named Daryl Zero, who solves complex cases using unique methods. It's a smart, humorous take on the detective genre that might appeal to you.

Alternatively, "Divergent" could also be interesting as it explores a dystopian society where people are divided by virtues, and the protagonist discovers she doesn't fit into any of these categories. This film delves into themes of identity and truth that might resonate with you. Enjoy your movie time!

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
Both "Windtalkers" and "Born on the Fourth of July" are compelling choices!

"Windtalkers" delves into a lesser-known aspect of World War II, focusing on Navajo Marines who used their native language as an unbreakable code. It stars notable actors such as Nicolas Cage and Noah Emmerich.

On the other hand, "Born on the Fourth of July" is based on the true story of Ron Kovic, a war veteran turned anti-war activist after feeling betrayed by his country following the Vietnam War. Tom Cruise delivers a captivating performance in this powerful film.
